name: rye dk
sizes_available: newborn (baby, toddler, child, adult s, m, l)
notes:
--------------------------------------------------------
--------------------------------------------------------

**rye dk** - by tin can knits
============

--------------------------------------------------------
--------------------------------------------------------

**the rye dk pattern is now available in the free tin can knits app!** 

[click here to download the app, or to learn more.][1]

• only see the size instructions you need
• tick through the pattern and make notes
• support is just a tap away
• adjust the settings to suit you!

***learn to knit with alexa and emily! the rye dk socks are part of [the simple collection][2] - a learn to knit series with excellent free patterns and clear tutorials.

from your first scarf, to mittens, socks, and sweaters, learn all you need to know to make modern seamless knits for the entire family!***

**want to keep up with tin can knits?**  sign up for our [email updates][3] and we will let you know about our new [designs][4] and great [in-depth tutorials][5].

--------------------------------------------------------
--------------------------------------------------------

**pattern info**
============

*note: looking for a heavier weight version of these socks? check out the [rye][6] sock pattern. or, for a lighter weight version try [rye light][7].*

**sizing**  
newborn (baby, toddler, child, **adult s, m, l**)

finished cuff/foot circumference: 4.25 (5, 5.75, 6.5, **7.25, 8, 8.75**)” around (unstretched)
leg: 2 (2.5, 4.5, 5.5, **6.5, 7.5, 8**)” from cast on to start of heel flap (adjustable)
foot: 3.25 (4, 5.25, 7.25, **8.25, 9.75, 11.5**)” from
back of heel to toe (adjustable)

**yarn**   
80 (100, 140, 200, 260, 320, 420) yards dk weight yarn

**gauge**  
28 sts and 38 rounds/ 4” in stockinette stitch on larger needles

**needles**  
us #2 / 2.75mm and us #3 / 3.25mm
*(or as required to meet gauge)*

dpns or long circular for magic loop

**notions** 
stitch markers, darning needle

**helpful tutorials**
[let's knit socks][9]

--------------------------------------------------------
--------------------------------------------------------

for all pattern abbreviations, techniques, and to contact us, visit [www.tincanknits.com][10]
